definition: to give up one's seat for sb
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: Rosa Parks, was arrested for not giving a white bus rider her seat, Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 帕克斯夫人是由於未給一名白人乘車者讓座而被捕。

sentences.english: On the bus we should offer our seats to the old, and young.
sentences.chinese: 公交車上，我們要主動給老幼讓座。

sentences.english: Do you have the habit that giving place to elder or kid forwardly when you got on?
sentences.chinese: 乘車時你有主動給老人和小孩讓座的習慣嗎？

sentences.english: He gave up his seat to an old man.
Sometimes a few old man to get on the car, we all rob the seats.
sentences.chinese: 不時有幾個老大爺上車，我們大家都搶着讓座。

sentences.english: Giving up your seat on public transport is a voluntary act.
sentences.chinese: 公交車上是否讓座是一種自願的行爲。

sentences.english: It's good manners to give seats to the old in the bus.
sentences.chinese: 在車上給老人讓座是一種好的舉止。

sentences.english: He offered his seat to a woman carrying a bady.
sentences.chinese: 他給一位抱孩子的婦女讓座。

sentences.english: Help guest to seat with smile and pleasant voice;
sentences.chinese: 爲客人拉椅讓座須面帶微笑，並伴隨令人愉悅的聲音。

sentences.english: I made room for a woman with child on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我在公共汽車上爲一位帶着孩子的婦女讓座。

sentences.english: He said it is very often that people give him their seat on bus.
sentences.chinese: 他說，在公共汽車上常常有人給他讓座。

sentences.english: He walks to my opposite, tingle noodles the old king have already let sign.
sentences.chinese: 他走到了我的對面，麻面老王早已讓座立起來。

sentences.english: On the bus, he gives his seat to an old person or a lady.
sentences.chinese: 在公交車上，他會給老人或者女士讓座。

sentences.english: We should to offer the seats to those elders.
Her refusal to give up her seat led to the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
sentences.chinese: 她拒絕讓座的行爲導致了蒙哥馬利巴士抵制運動。

sentences.english: The host offers seat and tea with sheer warmth .
sentences.chinese: 主人讓座又讓茶，十分熱情。

definition: to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
